> 
> Meanwhile, in Tucson's quarters, Tucson looks down at Wheelie and rea=
lizes that he had no idea of his change of status, seeing that the last tim=
e they were together Tucson was just an average comrade, just a slight larg=
er than Wheelie.  He heaves a sigh and kneels down to Wheelie.
> 
> " I was=
 going to give you a lecture and a warning but I realize you just comeback =
online after many vorns .   You were not aware of my change of status to Pr=
ime office and perhaps mistook me for my previous status.  I'll let it go t=
his one time, Wheelie but keep in mind that a Prime is a Prime no matter wh=
o they are.   All right, you're free to roam the Auto base now.  Please try=
 not to get sent to my office again, okay?"
> 
> With a smile of understand=
ing, Tucson opens the door to let Wheelie go on his   way.   Once having le=
t Wheelie free, he waits for Talon with a light hearted smile on his face.
=
> 


OOC - Uhm, I posted Wheelie leaving your quarters and he never entered=
 them in the first place, then him heading out.  So there's no way he coudl=
 have been there, and he wouldn't have gone back over to them!  So will pos=
e this as taking place out in the ship corridors.  Thanks!

Also, I appreci=
ate your posting, but it's sort of weird how you have each and every charac=
ter of your's coming up, then doing something to me, then knowing each and =
every thing that happened to each adn every other one that did, and them al=
l having the exact same opinions over on everyone as everyone else did.  

=
Also, unless your characte ris  asuperior officer who's going to emphatical=
ly order him to do something, please don't pose him going somewhere far els=
e after you for a setup.  Since it's hideously unrealistic for him to go ba=
ck to Tuscon's quarters twice now as you've posed him doing when he's not e=
specially fond of Tuscon, nor him following someone else as well when I pos=
d him trying to leave.  So, if going to go somewhere with him, please give =
me a cahnce to respond to it ahead of time.  It's two times you posed him e=
xtensively going with your characters when it was not in character for him =
to do so.

If your characters have had interactions with him in the past or=
 things I should know of, let me know?  As I have no idea where Wheelie int=
eracted with Tuscon or how they would have remotely konwn of one another, a=
nd you've posted repeaetdly that Tuscon knows him from the past, when I hav=
e no idea of that.

So again, if they've had interactions as NPC's, let me =
know their generic history so I can respond appropriately.  If he's going t=
o be told to go somewhere wtih someone, either give me a chance to respond =
appropriately if he does or not, or make it something like a specific order=
 in the case someone is a superior.  And it's also rather weird how your ch=
aracers come up from nowhere, all have the exact same opininos and back one=
 another up to the hilt on thier interactions and everything.  I feel kind =
of wedged into a corner by this.

I understand I'm new to the gruop and you=
've been here much longer, I just feel rather hemmed in on the character wi=
th what you're doing and am confused as to how things operate, and how you =
have all of your alts congregating and making me feel pressed into a corner=
.

Anyways, sorry if this is coming fof a bit too negative, thank you very =
much for the welcome here and for playing wtih me and interacting with Whee=
lie.

<Back In Character>

Wheelie, having met Tuscon up in the hall, gazes=
 over at him, "What is this with all of you?  You're back and forth whateve=
r I do.  This is what Prime is, just a rank?  It seems like it's just sort =
of dank.  We had four of five in a room, that's not a level of doom and glo=
om."

Then, walking away from Tuscon, but looking behind, "I'm glad you're =
good with all of your friends, congrualtions on the promotion and to whatev=
er ends.  But we, we were never friends.  We went back and forth in our way=
s, and I respect your orders for these days.  But we're not here to have fu=
n, we're here to fight and run and gun."

Wheelie leaning against the wall,=
 "I'll work wtih you, if you do tell, but I'm a soldier, and war is hell.  =
I'd prefer to keep my own advice, and I appreciate your friends, they try a=
nd be nice.  But don't have them ganging up on me and telling me what to do=
, or how you'll react, or on you'll I chew.  So by al lmeans, give me some =
space, we're here to fight for the future of our race."
